messages.message: Exporting results into Excel format (Export results -> Excel file) from an app batch run doesn’t work but the CSV download is successful
Steve - Can you share the files which you ran and the app details?

App is UK Company Incorporation https://aihub.instabase.com/hub/apps/bead5da5-2659-40c2-b611-d8e20de464bf.  Test files are https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1uKnAwlr-3qHu-96pAZVENMuFyZX5SYMV?usp=sharing.  I just tested on the AI Hub 10K app and the Excel results downloaded
@Steve Jenner when you say doesn't work, did it give an error or the button didn't do anything?
Button didn’t do anything.  Button very briefly changes to “Exporting” and then doesn’t download the Excel.
has this been resolved yet? if not, i’ll need to get admin credentials to debug since i think this is a private app created by Steve
No, still getting the same behaviour
sorry i stepped out. looking at this now

I found the issue. Looks like flow results export end point requires the class name to be shorter than 31 characters:
```msg: "An unexpected error occurred. (Error=Excel worksheet name 'Certificate Of Incorporation Of A Private Limited Company' must be <= 31 chars.)"
status: "ERROR"```

weird, do we not have the same requirement for csv files?

also, do you know where this error message is coming from? i can’t find it in the codebase

cc @danny.lan

Seems like its actually a requirement from Excel that worksheet names are shorter than 31 characters https://excelribbon.tips.net/T013175_Using_Very_Long_Worksheet_Tab_Names.html#:~:text=Excel%2C%20however%2C%20seems%20to%20limit,into%20Excel%20at%2031%20characters
seems like we need to impose a character limit on class names and also have better error handling on export

I put up a PR for the frontend changes.
@Kathy Wu is it also possible to set a maximum character limit on class names returned from the model?
